text: John Dennistoun (1803 – 9 September 1870) was a British Whig politician and banker. A member of Brooks's, he was elected Whig MP for at a by-election in 1870—caused by the resignation of James Oswald—and held the seat until 1847 when he was defeated. His brother, Alexander Dennistoun, was Whig MP for from 1835 to 1837. ==References== ==External links== * Category:UK MPs 1835–1837 Category:UK MPs 1837–1841 Category:UK MPs 1841–1847 Category:Whig (British political party) MPs for Scottish constituencies Category:1803 births Category:1870 deaths
title: John Dennistoun
